fields.headline: The Ashes: First Test archive
fields.bodyText: First day: England ride rollercoaster The first Test begins with a 427-run firework display, reports Mike Selvey. David Hopps sees England's No11 unleash a sting in the tail. Record start for Ashes series England's biggest last-wicket stands Second day: Sloppy England let the match slip out of sight before lunch England's startling ineptitude left Mike Selvey in a furore. As Waugh led his troops by example England only contributed to their owm misery. David Hopps watches Steve Waugh reach 9,000 Test runs Geoff Lawson on the role of Michael Slater Third day: Australian hammers break England's brittle batsmen Australia's 17th victory in 19 Tests brought humiliation to their timid hosts, whose fragile confidence - and even more fragile batting order - will not have been helped by the loss of the captain through injury for the second time this summer. Trescothick ready to step in as captain David Hopps on the captaincy crisis after Nasser Husssain's injury Geoff Lawson the role of Brett Lee Tanya Aldred on Australia's winning habit How the two teams have fared in Birmingham over the years
